Upon arriving at the HK Airport you take the Express Train to Central HK. There are free shuttle buses to the hotel (L2 bus if I remember) which make it very convenient. I stayed in an upgraded room giving me access to a lounge area on the 19th Floor with continental breakfast. First off, the rooms are comfortable having king size beds and a nice size for Hong Kong. They did not feel small which can be a problem in HK. The room had Internet (for a fee $120 HK/day) that worked well. The advertised lounge on the 19th floor was a joke. It was a small room 4 tables, a computer to use internet and some small food items left out. The 'lounge' looked like an afterthought in that they had an extra hotel room or storage room and they modified to serve as a lounge. Not worth the upgrade for th lounge. Do the upgrade for the room but not for the lounge access. Hotel is smack middle in the middle of the Wan Chai entertainment district, so you can expect a lot of people milling about going from bar to bar at night. I would recommend this hotel to people. My first choice would be the Eaton Hotel (half block away) and then the Wharney Guang Dong Hotel. Eaton Hotel had a little nicer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: OtaPorto
Reviews.Content: Central location but in a street in night clubs and prostitution. Very small rooms, a bathroom with rudimentary shower . Breakfast totally chinese, without ocidental food.

Reviews.Title: “Get the wireless sorted..”
Reviews.Author: mount1
Reviews.Content: Well located, good price, friendly enough staff BUT they need to get the wireless internet sorted. I stayed six days; it took 4 days for a technician to reset the wireless unit on my floor so the signal would hold stability. Business travelers rely on internet and don't mind paying HK$20 per hour for good stable wireless access.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: ArindamDas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Wharney Guangdong for 2 days while attending a conference in Hong Kong. Pros: 1. Location of the hotel and access to transport / shopping Cons: 1. Rooms are not spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not for the shy!”
Reviews.Author: toptotty66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the 9-14th April. paid £58 per room via BA stf Holidays. Location is Wan Chai which is the nightlife/red ligth district. very close to the MTR (train) which will take you anywhaer you need to go, the night market/ladies market/kowloon etc the trains are very quick clean and safe. The hotel room was big compared to othe HKG hotels i have stayed in. we had a double bed and a fold away bed 4 cases table chair and still had room. Our room was at the side of the hotel which was quiet, the front matbe noisy due to the main road and the clubs/bars and ladies of the night! Do not feel frightend or intimidated by these ladies and their madams. they are harmless and are just having fun and earning a living.... great for you guys out there! Myself, husbad and young son had no problem, they ended up saying hello to us as we had to walk past them every day to get to the hotel. The hotel staff are friendly, there are taxis everywhere and you can even store your luggage at the hotel after checking out if you have a late flight. There is a macdonalds and 7/11 on every corner. you will not go hungry here. All in all a good hotel, great location and will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good enough - great location.”
Reviews.Author: NinNelson
Reviews.Content: Ticked all the boxes, showing its age, (carpet very stained) but over all clean and tidy. FAntastic location near MRT. Tip - free internet available down first level of MRT (once you have gone through the turnstile) - usually did not have to wait to use one of the three available. Great for checking your email. DO; the bus trip around to Stanley Bay (sit at the top, its a cheap thrill!). Cafe Deco up the Peak is surprisingly affordable (by HK standards) and great view and yum food.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: verena_amber
Reviews.Content: Period of stay: 21-26 Feb 2009 The MTR station (Wan Chai) was about 7-10 minutes walk away, which was convenient if not for the numerous bars and pubs that I had to pass along the way, which made the area a tad complex and sleazy. The hotel wasn't top-rate, but for the price that we were paying, I wouldn't expect anything more. The room I had was not too small or large, acceptable for a local Hong Kong hotel, but I was assigned a room that had a bit of a weird musky smell, with stains in the carpet and upholstery of the armchair in my room. Thankfully, the bed sheets seemed clean enough and did not give me any trouble, although the mattress was a bit hard. Even with the room airconditioning off, the room was unbearably cold, and walls were rather thin, as I could sometimes hear the TV of the room next to mine. The corridors were dimly-lit and an odour lingered in the air, which suggests that they could probably do with some maintenance. The buffet breakfast was rather limited, so after 2 days I skipped it totally even though it was included as part of the room rate. Service of the hotel staff was generally ok. Check-in was pretty prompt, although I had to wait about an hour for my room to be ready. Other than that, I think the staff are quite professional and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Perfect Location, No problems!”
Reviews.Author: andrewdias
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wharney between Feb 14-19 2008. At first i was a little unsure, because of some of the negative reviews i'd read on this site. When i got there i was greeted by very friendly staff, and the check-in process was quick and simple. The room was a good size. the double bed was a little firm, but wasn't a problem, i had no problems sleeping. i can't beileve people who complain about the beds being too hard - they must be serial whingers! there was also no weird smells in the room, or stains on the carpet, as per previous reviews. There is a small bar fridge and the usual mini-bar stuff. but i would not recommend any of the stuff on offer. just go across the road to the 7-11 and buy whatever u need for much cheaper. The bathroom facilities were good. My room was located on the 11th floor, which is a non-smoking floor. The location of the hotel itself is perfect. Only a couple minutes walk to the MTR (underground, and the best way to travel), and about a 10-15 minute walk to the city centre (Central). When i was there, i NEVER had to take a cab anywhere. the hotel is located in Wan Chai. There are no problems from the red-light district scene. People will ask you to go into their bar, but all you have to do is politely decline. They will not hassle or harass you. I am a single guy, so i got asked quite a bit, but had no problems at all. It is a very safe place, so you don't need to worry. i had breakfast at the hotel restaurant, and it was buffet-style. Very good quality in my opinion, and it cost HKD$100. If you want more breakfast options, there is a 24hr place called the Flying Pan, about 30 seconds walk from the hotel - they do pancakes, omelettes, and things like that - also very good. I will definitely stay at the Wharney again and I hope this review will be of use to you.

Reviews.Title: “The very last time we stay here”
Reviews.Author: Lucyboom
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed in this hotel three or four times usually for about a week. We most recently stayed in December/January with my partner's parents and grandchild. I was really dissapointed at the room they gave my partner's parents and grandchild. Three single beds shoved into a tiny room, not room to walk around any of them and no room to sit down, other than on the bed. Their luggage was stacked up against the wall and it was just terrible. I know the rooms here aren't huge, I just expected when they booked a triple room there would be space for a chair and to walk around the beds (I mean these people are in their 70's!). I really felt bad, as it was my idea to stay here and I'd had previously okay experiences. Having said that, they still don't acknowledge the fact I have stayed here previously and the staff are pretty unhelpful, they are never able to recommend restaurants or shops and I don't think I will stay at the Wharney again.

Reviews.Title: “You'll love this location or not.”
Reviews.Author: DL_Pinner
Reviews.Content: I would class this hotel as 3.5*. I was on a trip with 3 other friends from London and stayed here for 6 nights. It was easy to get to on the Airport Express as following taking the Train from HK Airport, we took the Tourist Shuttle Bus H2 from Airport Express Station at Hong Kong to this hotel. For HK Island and the MTR this hotel is very well located, as Wanchai MTR is a 2-3 minute walk away. We paid GBP40 per night on the BA Holidays Website for room only, which is a bargain. Breakfast was copius and cost HK$98 per head. Never used the hotel restaurant but enjoyed many a good evening in the Canny Man Bar in the basement. The rooms are medium in size, unfortunately the beds are very hard and I found it difficult to sleep. Aircon was good. The bathrooms were small but clean. We stayed on the 15th floor. There is small but good steam room sauna adjacent to the hotel to enjoy. The greatest surprise was that this hotel is slap bang in the centre of the "red-light" area and this can be uncomfortable for couples or family groups. The hotel turns a blind eye to clients bringing women (mostly Philipinos) in with them. So beware. Also 15 metres from the hotel main door are "girlie-bars". But also there are good pubs and clubs, reataurants. In summary if you are on a boys trip and want a good location for HK touring then the Horney Hotel (sorry Wharney) hits the bullseye - otherwise there must be better choices!!.

Reviews.Title: “What a RIP-OFF”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Traveller58
Reviews.Content: The staff are very unfriendly and rude. This is definitely not a four star hotel as rooms are too small and hallway looks dirty and worn out. I booked this hot via online and paid a total of CANADIAN $ 264 for three nights, which averaged out to CAN$88 per night. However, i made a mistake a counted one day less without realizing. On the day that i was suppose to check out, i returned to the hotel in the evening to find the room was locked. After speaking with the receptionist who was very rude, i realized that i had miscounted the days and missed one. I then asked her to extend the stay for an extra night...for that i was charged CANADIAN$260 for the room for a night. I stayed in a superior room and they have charged me the posted rate for the deluxe room even though i never upgraded. On questioning them, they claimed that at different senario, they can charge a different price. I have never felt so rip-off before. The location itself isn't the best as there're many prostitutes and rowdy drunk bars hoppers hanging around every corner. I didn't feel save even to walk down the street at night. I do not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Small Room!”
Reviews.Author: mpeter
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for just one night for 110$ USD. the price was great, the location is good, but the rooms are really small. Definitely not a place to stretch out in. Please notice in the pictures of the hotel that everything is shot with a long lens to make it all seem bigger. The Lobby is nice and the staff is quite attentive, but be prepared for a cell sized room and very very hard beds! Its serviceable for a short trip if you are on a budget. Only a 3-5 minute walk to the wan chai train station and the neighborhood though near a 'red light" district feels quite safe and well lit.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - just”
Reviews.Author: steve_ben2004
Reviews.Content: The Wharney is listed in some guides as a 4* hotel. It is certainly not so. The room i was in, 1016 was very small - ok for one person, certainly not large enough for 2. The bed was very very hard and the bathroom was tiny. I am by no means tall - about 5ft 10 at a stretch and there was no way I could sit in the bath. When I arrived at the hotel I was given a very tatty room overlooking the back, despite having previously requested (and been granted) a renovated room, facing Lockhart Road. I managed to get a room change from the second night onwards. The room was kept spotlessly clean by the housekeeping staff but the carpet was really quite dirty and well worn. All in all the Wharney is a mid 3 * hotel - certainly not more. Although I love the location, I think I will be looking elsewhere for my next trip

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: parsifal
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through BA holidays primarily for its good price and location. It is situated in Wanchai close to the MTR (only two stops to Central), buses and trams. The area is very buzzy and there are some good bars and coffee shops nearby as well as more of what Wanchai used to be famous for - its a pale shadow now! We stayed (11 nights) in a standard room on the 11th floor overlooking Lockhart Road (don't stay here if you want a decent view) where there is always something going on. The room was of a reasonable size - two twin beds - and a decent bathroom. The beds are very firm which we liked. The standard of cleanliness was excellent. The staff throughout the hotel - reception, concierge, maids, bar - were, without exception friendly, helpful and all with a ready smile. We left our camera in the bar (The Canny Man) one evening - and didn't realise that we had lost it until the next morning. The staff were helpful and concerned and it was eventually discovered behind the bar where one of the bar staff had deposited it for safe keeping. This bar was generally very good - excellent staff and good food. The downside was that it could get very noisy especially on Friday nights with the biggest culprits being British expats trying to prove how brilliant they are - but, apart from that it was a good place to unwind. In summary - the Wharney is an excellent place to stay in HK - great location, good price, friendly and attentive staff - what more do you want!

Reviews.Title: “OK Stopover Hotel (Syd-Lon)”
Reviews.Author: Tortoise_n_Hare
Reviews.Content: Stay - 2 nights / 3 days. Location - Located in the area full of bars/adult clubs, the night life is best described as "interesting" During the day, a walk up to Time Square or down to the convention centre was OK. Room - Smallish, could do with a good clean (e.g. long hairs still on the floor) bathroom was fine. Room and entire floor had a funny smell (musty?); either floor had flooded recently or something was used to mask smell of cigarette smoke. Also, there are only 3 non-smoking floors. Food - Breakfast, again was just what you'd expect from a traveling business man's hotel, nothing flash, a bit of western and eastern hot foods - no service - had to get all food and coffee/tea yourself. We didn't have dinner there. Note: Yum Cha across the road was great, upstairs, has a big sign over the road Hoi-Tin I think. Staff - Mixed. Reception staff could do with a personality transplant; bell boys and security were friendly and always helpful with bags/doors/questions/etc. Overall - Used the travel agent for this booking, I didn't check it out online first and ended up with what I got. You'll be able to do much better for the same money with a bit of research.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience, great location”
Reviews.Author: freespirit_888
Reviews.Content: Good service, porter ran to take our bags when we arrived at the lobby. Always asked after us everyday we saw him. Some guests complained that staff was unfriendly, but we never found that, but its a 2-way thing - if your friendly they're friendly. One girl didnt understand English but she promptly asked her colleague to serve us who did. Rooms are like good 3* or low 4* european hotels. Smelt musty on first day but after that - no more smells. Beds were so hard when we first sat on them but when you sleep on them they were actually really comfortable. Really clean as I am quite sensitive and can feel bed mites - but no probs. Could see carpet stained where someone spilt a drink but you get disposable slippers so no probs. One funny thing was that my 6ft fiance didnt fit into the bath and when he stood up for the shower, had to bend his neck to wash his head. Good facilities, they even give you free toothbrushes, so one less thing to bring. Brilliant location, 2 mins from MTR, 5 mins from trams, 10 mins from ferry. Close to Wellcome supermarket for your bits. Only problem is that the bars on that road pump up the music on Thurs-Sat and even tho we were on the 19th floor we heard the music and screaming. Guess doesnt help that its rugby week - so not much sleep those few days! So joined in next day instead. Some reviews stated that the red night district bothered them, but we thought it was great, brilliant atmosphere not sleazy like France. Wouldn't feel intimidated if i walked there on my own more intimidated by the drunk tourists! Bad experience at American Peking restaurant. We walked in when closing but they asked us to go in, then many dishes we wanted werent avail. cos take too long to cook, so ordered other stuff. Then while we ate a waiter stood over us constantly looking at his watch, then the bill came and was extortionate! So got ripped off on an unpleasant meal! Not happy! Loved the Hay Hay restaurant tho, highly recommend the deep fried pigeon. So nice we went back on our last nite for that. If you're screamish ask them to leave the head out. Its detached but on the plate for deco. I know some ppl find that off putting. Also liked the garlic Gai Lan (greens), fruit punch, sweet and sour garoupa (fish). Suckling pig really fatty tho, so not a good choice. Overall it was a good stay, may go somewhere else next time only to try another hotel, but if stayed there again would be nice.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel on a not so nice street”
Reviews.Author: judy1019
Reviews.Content: the whole aura of the hotel was classy, the rooms were comfortable and of average size. the staff members were very friendly and helpful. the location of the hotel is about two blocks away from the wanchai mtr. my biggest problem were the clubs and pubs that were immediately adjacent and across from the hotel. it seemed a bit odd to be walking by sleazy women who worked hard to lure men into curtain covered doorways. and right next to a street full of what seemed like brothels is this beautiful hotel. so i guess if you don't mind that which men seem to enjoy greatly...the WGD is an absolutely great hotel i think for one or two travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Bowling Wharney!”
Reviews.Author: perthwatraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group during the 2007 Hong Kong 7s. Great position - in the heart of ALL the action. You would not want to be anywhere else. Lifts were slow, as was the toaster at breakfast. Rooms were quite comfortable and larger than I have stayed in elsewhere in Hong Kong - albeit mine smelt a big of fish. Lobby has a great chandelier and is a top place to people watch. Whilst the Hotel is a lttle tired - the hallway carpets needed a good clean - the accomodation provided value for mone

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice - especially for women business travelers”
Reviews.Author: SSR-RI
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights here during a business trip in early June. Not a very positive experience. The location may be centrally located for business but the hotel is located in a bit of a red light district and for a woman travelling alone as I was, it was kindof creepy being out after dark. The first room I was given was one of the most depressing hotel rooms I have ever seen - it looked as though it had not been touched since the late 1960s. All but three floors permit smoking so the smell of tobacco permeated everything, and finally make me a bit ill. I requested (and got) a new room on a non-smoking floor which was much cleaner and seemed to have been recently renovated. The outdoor pool is in an adjacent building and the pool deck had about 3 chairs, meaning everyone else sat on hard, hot concrete. The staff did their best with English but most had limited English skill and so nteractions were quite challenging. You can find a much better value and location in Hong Kong than this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great value great location”
Reviews.Author: alanpfc
Reviews.Content: 8 of us stayed in HK 22 - 28 July 07. We were there for the Asia Trophy. The staff were very efficient, enthusiastic, helpful and all spoke good English. It's true the rooms weren't huge by Florida standards but I've had smaller rooms in NY at more cost. The hotel is less than 1 minutes walk to the MTR (HK's fast and efficient rail system), trams and buses. Taxis stop outside. The hotel is an oasis among the bars, restaurants and convenience stores of Wanchai. We were a mixed group and, except when sightseeing or watching football, we stayed in the area. Not all Wanchai is dedicated to "girlie bars" and we found plenty of places to eat and drink without spending loads or being propositioned. Overall, a great hotel at a great price (booked via BA Hotels website). Would I recommend this hotel? Too right. Would I stay again? If ever my wife and I visit HK again we would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Roosta
Reviews.Content: Excellent location: 7-11 shops, Maccas, Coffee shops (with free Internet) and Starbucks, tramline, terrific bars, cheap and expensive places to eat and underground train station all within a 2 minute walk. A 5 to 10 minute walk will get you to some great markets (lots of street stalls) or to the harbour where you can catch the Star Ferry to Kolwoon. Our (buffet) breakfast was included in our price, was a good feed to get us going in the morning. The room was average, but this was expected for what we were paying, but it had all we needed and had nothing wrong with it. Checked in and out quickly. Have to wait a couple minutes usually for the lift, but that certainly didn't bother us. Overall, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Wharney”
Reviews.Author: bukidnonprincess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wharney Guangdong last June 18-20,2007. Our room. was moderate in size, very clean and orderly. The bathroom was also clean. The hotel is accessible to public transport ---MTR, buses, ferry, tram. There were also many restaurants around the area. It is true that it is located in a "red light district" but you wont feel harassed in the area and it is actually quite safe to walk to the hotel even at night. I booked this hotel through a website and found it to be good value for money. If you are travelling to Hong Kong for vacation, this hotel is walking distance to the bus stop to Ocean Park, to the Peak Tram terminus, to Pacific Place etc.

Reviews.Title: “Overall fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: loulouBS
Reviews.Content: I was born and bred in HK & this was my first time back there staying in a hotel. I expected a rather cheap but pleasant and clean hotel & the Wharney totally exceeded my expectations. Upon arrival the staff were friendly, quick to check us in & our rooms were clean, good sized & contained all the expected amneties (shower gel, safe, mini bar, hairdryer,etc). One staff member consistently went out of his way to help us (getting taxis, asking how we were, etc) & definately added so much to the hotel. We also left for 5 days to go to Thailand and were able to leave some luggage in the hotel free of charge. Throughout our stay the staff were incredibly helpful & when we arrived back from Thailand the hotel was full & we were put in a smaller room without a safe. I called to ask to change rooms & they said the next day when another was available they would do this for us. We arrived back the next night to a much bigger room! Our friend had a pretty horrible room on his return, but did not complain or ask to change, so I wouldn't put this as a negative as when we asked they were polite & apologetic. A few people on here have commented on the bad views, but as the previous reviewer said, you have to expect that in HK (unless you book a luxiourious hotel). Personally I loved looking out our window onto the bustle of Lockhart Road. Nearby is the MTR, buses, loads of restaraunts, bars, Wan Chai market, outlet shops. The bar downstairs "the Canny Man" is really relaxed and friendly (a Whiskey Bar my father used to frequent!) & you get a 10% discount if you are in the hotel - a nice getaway in the middle of WanChai. The area itself is great to walk around to get a nice mix of different aspects of HK (pick up a tourist map at the airport - so handy - we always had them at home, a free A-Z! The Wharney is also on there) No breakfast was included in our deal, but if you fancy a big English/American breakfast the building next door, 3rd floor, is a 24 hour (cheap) place called "the flying pan". Definately recommend. The American Restaurant (is actually Chinese food)(come out of the hotel & turn right- across the road) is famous for it's Peking Duck. We didn't use the swimming pool, but saw it & it looked very nice with outdoor jacuzzi! (Possibly not the most family friendly hotel due to the location as someone mentioned on here - right in the centre of Wan Chai which is known for strip bars - however when I was a child in HK I never really noticed them, so maybe through innocent eyes it doesn't actually matter! (and our family used to eat in Wan Chai a fair bit when I was younger) We are back to HK in Sept & definately staying at the Wharney again. If you have any questions message me!

Reviews.Title: “'Does what it says on the tin'”
Reviews.Author: Baby2
Reviews.Content: This a good 3 star hotel, lots of guests are attending the exhibitions nearby and probably a lot of package tours also. Located in busy Wanchai, in the street of nightclubs, filopina girls and a tatoo parlour. If that doen't bother you, it's a terrific location to take a taxi to Central, Causeway bay, Pacific Place. 5 mins away from bus stops to Stanley and the south of the island. A ten min walk to the ferry pier to Tsim Sha Tsui. Taxis on tap. Tram line also 5 mins walk (cheap and cheerful mode of transport). metro station 2 mins away. Also lots of bars and some decent restaurants nearby - such as Curry Pot and Chilli Club in the same street. Service is good, staff are friendly and helpful. This is a pretty good 3 star hotel which 'does what it says on the tin' and even has a bath tub in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: oxobob
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in march hotel was great very clean reception area and the staff at check in were very nice and helpful.Location is great you are only 2 minutes from trams and underground system .we were given a upgraded room and room very clean and looked very fresh room also larger than i expected i was worried before i arrived at this hotel as some reviews were not to encouraging but for anyone going to this hotel i would say you do not have any problems here and i am very fussy where cleanliness is concerned . Thank you to all staff at wharney hotel for a pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Yaxina
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easy to get to - thanks to the courtesy bus from the airport. Room was very clean with Sky TV, Mini bar. Location was great for us as it was close to lots of bars and clubs to enjoy in the evening. Near tram / subway routes.

Reviews.Title: “Basic & Cheap Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: debbiestothert
Reviews.Content: Arrived with my wife and daughter after a long 15 hours flight from Gatwick. Had booked a non smoking room and was shown to a room that was on a smoking floor. It really smelled badly of smoke. No problem they moved us to a non smoking floor. We were in hong Kong over Chinese New Year and had a great time, but would I recommend the hotel to friends? Not if they were bringing their families, only if they were going on a boys short break or for people who don't nind roughing it. The central location was great though

Reviews.Title: “Good value with great location”
Reviews.Author: Blinque
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wharney Hotel in Wanchai area of HK last week for 3 nights. Having read a couple of the reviews here before making my journey to HK, I didn't want to expect big things from this hotel (for starters, the name of the hotel doesn't make it sound like its a great hotel). We were initially planning to stay at the Novotel nearby, but it was fully booked so this was a cheaper option we took up, and on the map it's got really good location so we decided to make a reservation at the Wharney. I always think that how the hotel lobby looks would roughly give you an idea of how the room will be like. (although, I have been fooled on occasions). Walking into the lobby at Wharney Hotel, it was clean, well-lit, not too overly decorated, and well managed. Already I had a good impression. The rooms were small, (but every hotel in HK has really small rooms). They were clean, tidy. Bed was a bit hard, but it was alright. After a long day of shopping, you'd be so exhausted that the last thing you'd notice is the hard bed. They provide you with TV with satellite channels, and there's also wireless internet connection if you decide to bring your laptop along. The greatest thing about this hotel however, is the fantastic location. Only a stone's throw away from the Wanchai MTR station, you're only minutes away from the main shopping areas. The night life around the hotel is good too, with many pubs, and food stalls you can go to even at late hours of the night. One downside to this is there are quite a bit of prostitutes and strip bars around the area, and if you're a single man they do tend to bother you while you walk past them. Having said that, they don't post that much disturbance for it to be an inconvenience to you. If you're in a group, or with your girlfriend/wife, then chances are they'll leave you alone. Good value for money. It's no Four Seasons, but with the price that you're paying, and its great location, I'd say Wharney Hotel would be a place I'd consider staying in again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money - Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gelada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Wharney GuangDong Hotel from Aug 17-22. The room was small but functional and clean. Location is very good for walking around town (Wan Chai MTR station within a few minutes walk). Although the hotel was located in a "bad" area, surrounded by "strange" nightclubs and bars, we were not harrassed in any way. We had a comfortable stay. Hotel was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor!”
Reviews.Author: ashepDurban
Reviews.Content: This was a very disappointing hotel... When you first walk in you are dazzled by the stunning lobby and entrance hall... do not let the massive glass chandelier fool you. we had a horrific room... it was dirty and dusty, smelt very old.. and was tiny. Only one side of the bed had a bed side lamp, and the other side of the bed was right up against the wall.. not ideal! When we complained to the manager at the end of our stay he was shocked to hear that we had been put into one of the old rooms, apparently the whole hotel had been renovated except for a few rooms.. which had been given to us!! That is unbelievable.. and we were appalled. The road that the hotel is situated on is also appalling.. full of strip clubs and prostitutes and the hotel looks onto the back of a dilapidated old apartment block, so you get a great view of people bathing and hanging up their laundry... terrible!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jade_Ang
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Wharney GuangDong Hotel from 28-31 Dec. We were given a free upgrade from Deluxe to Executive Rooms due to the hotel being full. The room was small but functional and very clean. Although the hotel was located in a seedy area, surrounded by nightclubs and bars, we were not harrassed in any way. Also, the location was convenient with Wan Chai MTR station within a few minutes walk and lots of eateries nearby. We had a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, pity about the location!”
Reviews.Author: BigBarney
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from the Cathay Pacific Holidays brochure. I chose this hotel because it seemed to meet all my needs, it is on the island, it is close to an MTR (subway) station and is centrally placed for access to all the attractions of Hong Kong. My wife and I arrived from Brisbane, Australia after a great holiday for a 4 night stopover en route to the UK. We arrived late at night (11.15pm) and checked in with no fuss. Our room (1106) was a lot smaller than we had hoped for but clean and quite stylish. First problem was there is nowhere to put clothes! There is a wardrobe but only one small drawer in the writing desk. So we lived out of our suitcases for 4 nights. The Wan Chai area is quite seedy with several dodgy looking night clubs almost next door.

Reviews.Title: “Value and convenience”
Reviews.Author: David007
Reviews.Content: I recently had two short five day stays at the Wharney. I was somewhat concerned travelling with two teenage children having read some of the previous reviews regarding the ‘girlie bars’, but these were not an issue. If you are not a punter, they are not interested, although they would always give a polite ‘hello’. On the positive side, the hotel is excellently positioned for transport. The MTR is a few minutes walk away, as is a branch of the China Travel Service should you need a Chinese Visa in a hurry. The taxi to both Star Ferry terminals (at Wanchai and Central) is around HK$15, and the Wanchai terminal can be walked to above ground. Taxi to Peak tram was around HK$20. We requested non-smoking rooms, which we had on both stays. Well done! Regarding eating, once again the hotel has excellent local facilities. Having read the reviews we did not eat at the hotel, but rather took our chance locally. There are two excellent restaurants nearby: Jo Jo’s Mess (Indian) located above the Bottoms Up bar, and our favourite, the Chili Club. Pacific Place is also good, and there are plenty of good local places as well. The hotel has three 7-11 stores within 100 yards, which is great for that soft drink and quick snack. Also there is Starbucks around the corner for that caffeine fix! During our second stay we were positioned on the 15th floor, where the refurbished rooms were better than the 12th. Rooms were typically HK: small yet functional. Rooms had a mini-bar and coffee making facilities, and whilst the towels were a bit ‘thin’ they were clean. Room were cleaned daily and the bell hops were very attentive. The staff at reception tried their hardest at English, and as is usual in this part of the world, a smile and a gentle request is better received than a raised voice. We had a couple of hours by the pool which was adequate, but slightly strange being surrounded by 20+ storey buildings! On the downside, the hotel’s surroundings can be noisy (open bars playing late night music), although being on the 12 and 15 floors, this did not bother us. Breakfast was not expensive at HK$99, but there are plenty of places around the hotel where you will pay up to HK$25 for something reasonable. And finally, the nightmare that was ‘waiting for lifts’! Three lifts: not funny. It was not unusual to wait for 5 minutes for an empty lift, at any time of the day (or night). The hotel needs to get this sorted. In summary, given what we paid (we booked through BA), I have no complaints and would stay again at the Wharney. It’s not 5* but you don’t expect 5* when you’re only paying for 3*.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: HUNTINGPARTY
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for one night on a stop over to Australia, having got really good deal (£36 per room) over the web. I had read the reviews here before we went and was a little concerned about the area but we found it no problem. The children (14 & 12) thought the bars amusing and we never felt threatened or intimidated even though we were walking about quite late at night. The rooms were small and the beds were hard - but that seems to be the norm in Hong Kong. We had requested a non-smoking floor and adjoining rooms. They managed the no-smoking but the rooms were next-door but one even though the room in between seemed to be unoccupied. The corridor was a bit noisy and the pool looked a bit dingy but the staff were pleasant and spoke very good English.

Reviews.Title: “Budget”
Reviews.Author: browner_
Reviews.Content: Well, I booked this hotel because it was the cheapest with a swimming pool, and I cant complain too much because I got what I expected. Our room was dull, tired and cramped, but cool and reasonably quiet. We faced the back of the hotel, but lower rooms could probably be noisy as there was a very loud American pub on the road below. I would imagine some of the front facing rooms could be noisy was well, as the road is very busy with traffic and clubs/bars. The basement bar was like a British pub with TV screens which was handy during the football World Cup. The pool was adequate but quite cold (this was in June) and only worth a quick dip. The spa pool was even colder! The location is great if you like the pubs and clubs and dont mind being grabbed by hookers as soon as you walk out the hotel. Some people would describe the location as seedy but I had my family with me and it didnt bother us. There are loads of bars/clubs,shops and restaurants in the immediate vicinity set amongst the "ladies" bars -each of which has several Filipino women hanging outside trying to tempt you in. When with my wife I was left alone, but when on my own the women always grabbed my arm. But it was friendly, never threatening. This hotel will suit undemanding budget travellers or those who want to party hard in the locality. Oh, and the staff were exceptional, very very helpful, all speaking good english.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Frequentflyer2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a lot of hotels in HK and on Kowloon but now I go back to the Wharney which is much cheaper than most HK hotels of comparable standard and probably better than most. Some clarification needed though because I wouldn't recommend it for a family stay but for singles, younger couples and especially guys, its pretty hard to beat for value and location. Yes, some of the rooms need a refurb but they're getting round to doing them and if your not happy with what they give you they'll normally change without much fuss. Breakfast is good, but now there's a breakfast club next door (3rd floor) serving 24hr breakfasts so no need to rush down to the hotel restaurant! I've not patronised the Canny Man, but with so many good bars in and around the hotel there's not much point drinking in a downstairs hotel bar when you can sit and watch the world go by in a heap of other bars. Hostess clubs next to the hotel are a bit off putting at first but once they realise that you either a 'goer' or a 'no-goer' they'll either leave you alone or be your best friend. All pretty harmless really and nothing much to see, unless you like looking at curtains! Great bars close by, too many to mention and lots of good, inexpensive eating places. You can spend a fortune on food in HK, but plenty of good value eateries in Wanchai. Also, hotel is ideally located for MTR, buses, trams, convention centre, ferries, etc. Great shopping too...discount clothes shops, electrical discount centres, mobiles, everything close at hand. Pacific Place (shopping, eating, cinema) is only a short walk away too.

Reviews.Title: “is this the worst 4* (worst hotel?) in Asia ?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Damp sheets, bad air conditioning, noisy (as if you are sitting in the middle of a football match), smelly room. I have stayed in cleaner better rooms in Chung King mansions. Can someone please tell me how this hotel got a 4 star rating Don't be conned by ISO rating either

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter999
Reviews.Content: Perfectly adequate hotel which I got a very reasonable rate with British Airways. The staff were fine and the room was OK if a little small. It is well situated five minutes from the MTE & close to the Convention Centre. One word of warning. It is in the redlight district. Its perfectly safe but you might get accosted returning to the hotel in the evening. The hotel is very good value if you are looking for a room offering somewhere to rest and sleep and you will spend most of your time touring Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: caliduuude
Reviews.Content: it's a great place to stay .if you get the right room. the first room i had was worn out and cramped.i then got moved to a better room on a higher floor .this room was newly renovated,with all the bells and whistles.a great room.with a safe and mini bar ,refidge,etc. the location is close to the metro line less than 2 blocks,so is some great dining and bars.no need for me to look for another place to stay while in H.K.,it's the Wharney for me.great staff that jump over backward for ya.they're really great folks.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Richpar
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from 4 nights at the Wharney, and left satisfied that we got what we came for. As described in other reviews, the rooms aren't huge, and could certainly do with an update. However, they are clean and look like most other hotel rooms the world over. We got a deal through STA Travel for the double room for 4 nights for £200, so as far as value goes the Wharney has to score quite highly. We didn't use any other facilities, we planned to use the pool, but it's closed for 5 months over winter (not mentioned anywhere before booking). Again, this has been covered before, but do be aware that you're staying in Wan Chai, and that the hotel is in the heart of the hostess club district. This isn't at all noticable when you're in the room, but as soon as you're outside it's pretty in-your-face. It's a shame as there are a good few bars on Lockhart Rd too, but if you sit outside for too long the seedier side of Wan Chai begins to surface. It's not as intimidating as other cities perhaps, but just do be aware. Overall, the hotel is good value, is located centrally on Hong Kong island, and the staff are pretty helpful. Don't expect any glitz and glamour, or much space in your room, but the hotel does what it says on the tin!
